page.title: 08THE LOWER SCHOOL, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: The first school was built in the mid {1800s}when the population was about {400. }At that time approximately{50 children of all ages attended the school. In the early{1900s}one local resident recalls how the children were punished, infants received sharp smacks on the wrists, juniors were hit on the wrists with a ruler and seniors caned on the hand. Nowadays the old school-house is situated within a housing estate near the{10 year old present school, which is funded by the {West Charity. }The school has only{28 pupils but room for more. There are{2 full time staff and some clerical assistants. Advantages are each child has more help. The atmosphere is cosy. The friendly atmosphere means pupils dislike competition. Staff and parents believe the school is still open because of its obvious community need.
